item.title: Snap Out of It! How I’m Learning to Thrive in Boredom Instead of Scratching It Away
item.description:
The Pit

Books unread, movies unwatched, and abandoned projects—why? When did I become so easily distracted? When did enjoyable activities and hobbies become a chore? And when did we become pawns, so easily influenced and signed over our attention and focus, letting corporations make money off it for free?

Attention is a highly valued asset, so no wonder the marketing industry is valued at $481 billion. From influencers sharing referral links for lip gloss in shades identical to countless others, to politicians dividing people with inflammatory comments, and then there’s a cute kitten hopping into a box—all within a minute of scrolling through Instagram. It’s no surprise we feel our attention slipping away.
